title: Donor Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions: there was a lots of situation question, educational background check, career history, it was a long process to do the whole both online and in person interviews. it takes time while they are going to connect with you as an applicant
Interview Questions: What is your educational background?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was respectful to the interviewee. He only asked adequate questions and was willing to answer my questions. The length of the interview was okay. It was a very pleasant interview overall.
Interview Questions: General interview questions were asked.

title: Engineering Coop Student Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions: It is like other coop interviews. There were 2 or 3 people. They want to have a conversation basically with some questions. They are pretty chill and its a good conversation
Interview Questions: What is your biggest achievement in your opinion?

title: Marketing Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions: Went to the very end of the process (2 phone interviews, 1 in-person) where they check all my references. Got positive feedback from my references then I got a voicemail on a friday afternoon from the company saying they went with someone else. I called them back immediately to get feedback and insights and the HR lady put her voicemail to vacation mode and never got a call back.
Interview Questions: Standard questions in a interview.

title: IT Security Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions:
Director is very nice and the whole process takes about two weeks. They do not ask tough technical questions, but are more focused on your experience.
Their background checking is relatively restricted.
Interview Questions: Mostly focusing on your past experience.

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions:
Phone screen then in person interview, behavioural style questions and a technical test.
The process didn't take too long, whole process was completed in less that a month.
Pretty easy process overall.
Interview Questions: How would you embody the values of the organization

title: Shipper/Receiver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions:
It is an easy one-on-one phone interview with the hiring manager.
Very general behaviour questions.
The whole process is very professional and efficient.
The hiring manager keeps helping candidates feel as relaxed as possible to elicit the best response. 
It takes around 20-30 mins to finish the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength?

title: Donor Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions: It was smooth and interactive. they ask good questions and love engagement. They are also very friendly and love someone who  is open and alway willing to help others. they love confidence but still humble and someone who is graceful also.
Interview Questions:
what attracted you to CBS
why do you feel you are the right fit for the role

title: Industrial Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (London, ON) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Got an HR interview call, later got REJECTION e-mail. Then I got an HR call for 2nd round with Hiring manager and some other director. After that I got an interview with hiring manager and later call from HR that they are moving with other applicants. IT was YES/NO/YES/NO kind of interview.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions, STAR example.

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Sudbury, ON)
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty intense, over the phone. But it went well! I feel like I learned a lot about the company and was able to truly sell myself. They asked about my education, my experience, how I felt about traveling, etc.
Interview Questions: Why I would be a good fit in this position.

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview. The company  not follow up after the interview to let me know I did not proceed, which was disappointing, Two interviewers, one from HR and the Hiring Manager.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of your experience coordinating volunteers.

title: Software Developer I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process had two rounds:

1. HR round: The HR asked very simple and general questions related to experience, salary, availability.

2. Manager round: Behavioral and situational questions again related to previous experience, weaknesses and strengths
Interview Questions:
1. failure
2. previous experience
3. strength, weakness, willingness to learn

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Ottawa, ON) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Got an email after 1+ month I applied online, someone from the HR department emailed me that they want to arrange a telephone interview, did the telephone interview 2 days after and got a panel video call interview the same week.
Interview Questions: Why would you choose our company?

title: Research Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Ottawa, ON) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was a friendly team. I was asked questions about my previous work and research history. I shared concrete examples of each of them and explained how my previous research would align with some of the tasks I would be assigned at the Canadian Blood Services.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Hamilton, ON) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial screen by recruitment followed by panel interview with four interviewers. They take turns in firing questions one after the other with no icebreakers . Fairly intense process lasting almost an hour.
Interview Questions: Panel interview with a series of situational questions that are related just asked in different ways. Mostly negative conflicting questions to gauge how one deals with  difficult situations. Also on KPIs

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Ottawa, ON) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a 2 interviews, one over the phone and one in person with the hiring manager. It was pretty laid back- not intense, i felt comfortable enough to answer all questions asked
Interview Questions: Tell me about your project experience?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Calgary, AB) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It is mostly about behavioral questions, the candidate must be ready for those type of questions using different websites. Also it is very much important to give examples for whatever you have done in the past or any behavioral actions you have taken to solve an issue. Keep reminding any scenarios you have had in the past.
Interview Questions: Any experience about suggestions you made to cut the costs

title: Enterprise Software Developer Co-op Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview that started with the basic info about myself, why I want the position, some basic small talk happened organically. Followed by some basic technical questions about object oriented programming, Java and databases.
Interview Questions: When would you use an interface vs abstract class?

title: Donor Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (London, ON) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Started with a behavioural phone interview (personality check) and followed by an in person interview with the manager, supervisor, and trainer where they went through the example of schedule, the hours, the expectations and some situational questions. As it's shift work with no consistent shift they wanted to make sure it was a good for me and them. Lasted 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How would you handle someone not wanting you to perform their phlebotomy

title: Technical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone Screening HR Screening (15 - 30 min)
2. Main Interview (panel; includes HR; Behavioral (1 hr))
3. Written Test

The process took 8 weeks (too long) to come back with a result.
Interview Questions: Don't remember; typical behavioral assessment interview.

title: Software Developer Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Ottawa, ON) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone call with team lead I applied for. Very fun chat, talked about who I am in general, what experience I have, some questions about school, and then a few technical questions that aren't all too hard.
Interview Questions: Difference between Interfaces and Abstract classes?

title: Enterprise Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got my interview in a week. It was a face-to-face interview. The interviewer is professional and friendly. He explained the job and every day tasks, and the process of the interview, which would start with technical questions.
Interview Questions: Professional questions from OOP, SQL, to Java specific questions.

title: Donor Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a telephone interview and then an in person interview with 2 clinic supervisors whom asked lots of scenario questions regarding customer service and duties of a receptionist such as communicating effectively and using Microsoft Office.
Interview Questions: What does you role as a donor service representative mean for the organization?

title: Donor Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Winnipeg, MB)
Interview Descriptions: Initial telephone interview.  Asked to "describe a situation when.." type question.  Roughly 3 questions asked and a description of the job offered.  When make it to in person interview, it was more informal and experience was discussed.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you had to act under pressure.  What was the situation and what was the outcome.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Sudbury, ON) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: You basically do some office admin and simple data entry work. Also they give you a Whmis training card after you finish test. The process takes a few months but they love to hire students.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in customer service?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions:
HR recruiter called to set up phobe interview
Telephone interview from Toronto HR
Then interview by 1 or 2 supervisors in person
Heard back about the job within a 2 week time period.  Orientation was okay.  People are nice to work with. It's a union position part time
Interview Questions: Conflict situation

title: Shipper/Receiver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received phone call to set up interview, went the next day, interview took about 40 minutes, got offered the job 2 days later. Received phone call to set up interview, went the next day, interview took about 40 minutes, got offered the job 2 days later.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult people?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services
Interview Descriptions: I brought my credentials with me and references, they provided the job description, 2 managers, 30 minute interview, inquired about my past experience as a nurse, they asked critical thinking questions, they completed the interview in a positive manner and I heard from them within 2 days.
Interview Questions: confidentiality breach

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Saskatoon, SK) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for this position was in two-stages. The first stage consisted of an over the phone interview with an HR rep in Winnipeg. The second stage of the interview process consisted of an in-person meeting in front of a small panel. The second interview consisted primarily of a review of past experience (and questions about this) as well as a short 'quiz' of provided scenarios and how I would respond to these.
Interview Questions: You've got a clinic scheduled for community X on date Y. On the day of, you find out that the building is unavailable due to a (flood, burst pipe, overlapping booking). How do you respond? What are the steps you take to remedy this? Why?

title: Collection Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Edmonton, AB) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pre screening over the phone followed by an hour long in person interview with another manager on a conference call.  It was a very smooth and easy process as the HR department was very helpful in sending out the proper forms and ensuring I knew exactly how to fill them out.
Interview Questions: Lots of scenario questions about integrity. Ex) What would you do if you made a mistake and no one knew? What would you do if you were given this situation?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Ottawa, ON) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of questions about experience, and I had the opportunity to speak about my best work experiences, what I enjoy and my goals.  The panel was very friendly, encouraging and supportive.
Interview Questions: Have you been in a position where you had to report a negative project outcome to senior management, and how did you deal with that situation?

title: Territory Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services (Edmonton, AB) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was funny, a mock presentation about a partner program that you really didn't know anything about. I laughed later when I did know the program and thought back to my presentation. It was a two person panel and they alternated asking questions. The questions were standard sales process and customer service oriented. The interview process took about 45 minutes total.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult customer?

title: Lab Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Canadian Blood Services in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call about three weeks after applying. Then I had two interviews by phone. The first one was general, about the position, and my experience. Second one was behavioral. Then, they call the more suitable candidates for a technical interview. I wasn't called but at least they call me to let me know that somebody else got the job.
Interview Questions: There were no surprise questions. Is very standard like: Tell me about a problem you had with a coworker and how did you fix it.
